We would like to provide some clarification on questions regarding half-face shields. Half-face shields, like the one pictured, are not in compliance with TEA and UIL regulations for use by students or spectators at public school events. For reference, the UIL regulations are cited here: https://www.uiltexas.org/policy/covid-19/2020-2021-uil-covid-19-risk-mitigation-guidelines

Face Coverings- Executive Order GA-29
Executive Order GA-29, regarding face coverings, applies to all UIL activities effective July 3, 2020. This includes the 2020-2021 school year.

For the purposes of this document, face coverings include non-medical grade disposable face masks, cloth face coverings (over the nose and mouth), or full-face shields to protect eyes, nose, and mouth.
All employees, parents, visitors and students ten years of age or older must wear face coverings or face shields upon entry to an area where UIL activities are being conducted and when not actively practicing or playing in the contest.

Attention FISD families! We want to make you aware of a benefit that may be available to your family. Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. The P-EBT application is set to open online at hhs.texas.gov/PEBT this week.

P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. Because Ferris ISD is a Community Eligibility Provision school, and all students receive free meals, all FISD students are eligible to apply. For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT and watch for additional information to be mailed home this week.

FISD Family

FISD will participate in meetings with the Ellis County area health agencies later this morning, as well as with the Texas Education Agency Commissioner, Mike Morath this afternoon. Based on the outcome of these meetings, FISD will make a decision late this afternoon about the possible extension of spring break. As you are aware, many DFW area school districts are making spring break extension announcements as they meet with their local health agencies. These school closure decisions are based on these health agency recommendations.

As we have shared before, this situation is very fluid and information is rapidly changing. We are continuously monitoring and assessing the situation and will make ultimate decisions in the best interest of our students, staff, and community. Thank you for your patience and understanding during this unprecedented time.

This past weekend. "Our Ferris High School Cadet Police Academy (FHSPA) competed at the 2019-2020 TPSA (Texas Public Service Association Northeast) Regional Conference. We took eight students, six as competitors and two as volunteers. They competed in three events, Traffic Stop, Female and Male Agility Course, and Report Writing, placing in two of those Traffic Stop and Female Agility Course.
The competition team consisted of Vanessa Guevarra, Colman Flores, Taylor Peters, Lili Garcia, Braydon Smith, and Elise Rachel. The volunteers were Emilie Alfaro and Katie Schell. Out of those Lili Garcia took 1st place in Female Agility Course and Taylor Peters took 3rd in traffic stop. Both have qualified for the state competition
I am extremely proud of all of them and I am really optimistic about the future of The FHSCPA." -Officer Smith, Ferris ISD P.D

Amazing job students and Officer Smith!

Got a really awesome package in the mail today from the students and staff of Ferris ISD! Completely took me by surprise to get such an awesome box from my hometown! Being in the military, out to sea, and away from family is hard enough, but you guys really out did yourselves with these caring cards. Definitely brightened my day, and made it feel less stressful being here. Shout out to Brenda Garcia, a fellow classmate, band geek, and art teacher at Ferris Intermediate, as well as the other wonderful staff for getting this box together! Someone help me out to tell them! Thank you guys so much for the kind thoughts and cards! Y'all are the best! <3 <3 <3
